summary: G. Robert Blakey was involved with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is the sender of a letter to Scott Breckinridge at the CIA requesting assistance in arranging interviews in Mexico with individuals like June Cobb Sharp and Henry P. Lopez. These interviews were related to the HSCA's investigation, and Blakey noted the sensitive nature of the information. He was likely a leading figure in the HSCA, given his role in requesting CIA assistance for interviews related to the JFK assassination investigation. The documents span from 1977 to 1979, indicating his involvement with the HSCA during that period.
significance: As the sender of a letter requesting CIA assistance for interviews in Mexico, G. Robert Blakey played a role in the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. His correspondence highlights the committee's efforts to gather information and the sensitive nature of the investigation.
